DataElement.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the gastrointestinal stromal tumor based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor Pathologic N Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A stromal tumor most commonly seen in the gastrointestinal tract. Rare cases of solitary masses in the omentum or the mesentery have also been reported (extragastrointestinal gastrointestinal stromal tumor).  It is a tumor that differentiates along the lines of interstitial cells of Cajal.  Most cases contain KIT- or PDGFRA-activating mutations. Until recently, surgery has been the only effective therapy for this tumor.  However, many patients still experience recurrence.  Conventional chemotherapy and radiation therapy have been of limited value.  A KIT tyrosine kinase inhibitor, imatinib mesylate (also known as STI-571 or Gleevec), is now effective in the treatment of relapsed and unresectable cases._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: GIST. A type of tumor that usually begins in cells in the wall of the gastrointestinal tract.  It can be benign or malignant.

Concepts.definition: A stromal tumor most commonly seen in the gastrointestinal tract. Rare cases of solitary masses in the omentum or the mesentery have also been reported (extragastrointestinal gastrointestinal stromal tumor).  It is a tumor that differentiates along the lines of interstitial cells of Cajal.  Most cases contain KIT- or PDGFRA-activating mutations. Until recently, surgery has been the only effective therapy for this tumor.  However, many patients still experience recurrence.  Conventional chemotherapy and radiation therapy have been of limited value.  A KIT tyrosine kinase inhibitor, imatinib mesylate (also known as STI-571 or Gleevec), is now effective in the treatment of relapsed and unresectable cases.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created per request by COG for their APEC14B1 study in Rave. mc 8/25/15

ValueDomain.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 N Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of gastrointestinal stromal tumor, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor pN0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor pN0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gastrointestinal stromal tumor with no evidence of metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor pN0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Gastrointestinal stromal tumor with no evidence of metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gastrointestinal stromal tumor with regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Gastrointestinal stromal tumor with regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
